comments.body: I might be missing something, but how does it return `false` if the return type is `void`?

It was an arbitrary decision. I didn't want to constrain the return type of handler callbacks, since the Router only cares about whether the returned value `=== false`. Any other value is simply ignored. I don't want to invalidate existing code that relies on this behavior.

Perhaps returning `any` or `unknown` might have been better? Ideas are welcome.

Edit: I changed the return type to `any`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +16,20 @@ *
 * In synchronous mode, the handler is called with all matched tokens as
 * arguments. If a handler returns `false`, the router will skip all remaining
 * handlers.
 *

comments.body: From the usage, it seems like this might have been intended to be a union?

If you look at [`methods.js`](https://github.com/flatiron/director/blob/master/lib/director/http/methods.js), director actually exports this array. Admittedly there is no practical use for it, since it is only used to bootstrap the helper methods during class initialization.
